definitions: willing to give money, help, or time freely and in large amounts
larger or more plentiful than usual or necessary
examples: She made a generous donation to the local charity
The restaurant owner was generous with free samples
The chef served generous portions of pasta to everyone
We were given generous time to complete the project

definitions: connected with a court of law, judges, or the administration of justice
having or showing careful consideration and good judgment in making decisions
examples: The judicial system needs reform to reduce case backlogs
She pursued a career in the judicial branch of government
He took a judicial approach to resolving the workplace dispute
The committee made a judicial review of all the evidence

definitions: in a state of mind that prevents normal perception, behavior, or social interaction
so extreme as to be considered completely unreasonable or inappropriate
examples: The defendant was declared legally insane during the trial
He was admitted to a hospital for the criminally insane
The traffic during rush hour is absolutely insane today
It's insane to attempt that dangerous stunt without training

definitions: having or showing a sensible and practical idea of what can be achieved
representing things in a way that is accurate and true to life
examples: We need to set realistic goals for the quarterly sales
She has realistic expectations about her career advancement
The movie's special effects were incredibly realistic and convincing
The portrait was so realistic it looked like a photograph

definitions: relating to Americans of African ancestry, their culture, history, or identity
examples: The museum features African-American art from the twentieth century
She studied African-American literature in her college course

definitions: concerned with or involving the theory of a subject rather than its practical application
based on theory or speculation rather than practical experience or proven fact
examples: She has strong theoretical knowledge of physics and mathematics
The course covers both theoretical and practical aspects of engineering
His argument remains purely theoretical without any supporting evidence
The theoretical possibility exists, but it's never been demonstrated

definitions: relating to or involving the use of technology, especially advanced scientific knowledge applied practically
examples: The company invested heavily in technological advancement and innovation
We live in an era of rapid technological change

definitions: awake and able to understand what is happening around you
done deliberately with full awareness of what you are doing
examples: The patient remained conscious throughout the medical procedure
She was barely conscious after the accident
He made a conscious effort to arrive early
We need to be conscious of our environmental impact

definitions: recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge
established as true or having happened based on evidence or experience
examples: She's known for her excellent customer service skills
This restaurant is known throughout the city for its seafood
There are no known side effects of this medication
The known facts don't support that theory

definitions: relating to people who are between thirteen and nineteen years old
examples: She volunteers at a center for teenage mothers
His teenage years were filled with music and sports

definitions: spoken rather than written; verbal
relating to the mouth or done by the mouth
examples: Students must pass both written and oral examinations
The tribe preserved its history through oral traditions
The dentist recommended better oral hygiene practices
This medication is taken through oral administration

definitions: completely certain about something or firmly persuaded of the truth of something
examples: She was convinced that her solution was the best
I'm not convinced this plan will work effectively

definitions: forming an unbroken whole or sequence without interruption or exception
examples: The machine requires continuous power supply to function properly
We've had continuous rain for the past three days

definitions: at a higher level or layer than something else
higher than a particular amount, rate, or standard
examples: The apartment above ours is being renovated
Dark clouds gathered in the sky above
Temperatures rose above ninety degrees yesterday afternoon
Students scoring above average will receive special recognition

definitions: giving a sense of happy satisfaction or enjoyment; agreeable
examples: We had a pleasant conversation over afternoon tea
The weather was pleasant enough for an outdoor picnic

definitions: protected against a particular disease by particular substances in the blood
not affected or influenced by something
examples: Vaccinated children are immune to measles and mumps
His strong immune system fought off the infection
No one is immune to criticism in this profession
The economy is not immune to global market changes

definitions: exactly alike in every detail; precisely the same
examples: The twins wore identical outfits to the party
These two signatures are identical in every way

definitions: exceptionally good or excellent; distinguished from others by superiority
remaining to be paid, done, or dealt with
examples: She received an award for outstanding academic achievement
The restaurant is known for its outstanding service
There are still outstanding issues to resolve before closing
He has several outstanding parking tickets to pay

definitions: difficult or impossible to understand, explain, or identify; full of mystery
examples: A mysterious stranger appeared at the door last night
The ancient ruins hold many mysterious secrets

definitions: having a very pleasant taste or smell that gives great pleasure
examples: The homemade apple pie was absolutely delicious
A delicious aroma filled the kitchen while cooking

definitions: very great, intense, or deep in degree, quality, or extent
showing great knowledge, insight, or understanding of complex matters
examples: The loss had a profound impact on the family
She felt profound sadness at the news
The professor made profound observations about human nature
His profound understanding of physics impressed his colleagues

definitions: protected against danger, damage, or unwanted access
firmly fastened or fixed so as not to move
feeling confident and free from fear or anxiety
examples: The building has secure entry with keycard access
Store your valuables in a secure location
Make sure the ladder is secure before climbing
The rope was secure around the heavy load
She feels secure in her new job position
Children need to feel secure and loved

definitions: situated on or forming the outside part or surface of something
examples: Remove the outer layer of the onion first
The outer walls of the castle were crumbling

definitions: about to happen or appear in the near future
examples: We're preparing for the upcoming holiday season
Check the calendar for upcoming events and deadlines

definitions: marked by exactness and accuracy of expression or detail
examples: The surgeon made precise incisions during the operation
Please give me the precise measurements for the shelf

definitions: of middle size, degree, or amount between extremes
a particular form or system of communication, art, or entertainment
examples: Order a medium pizza for the two of us
Cook the steak to medium temperature
Television is a powerful medium for advertising
The artist works in the medium of watercolor

definitions: having a color between red and blue like that of a violet or amethyst
examples: She wore a beautiful purple dress to the wedding
The sunset painted the sky in shades of purple

definitions: operating by or producing electricity; concerned with electricity
examples: The house needs major electrical repairs and rewiring
He studied electrical engineering at the university

definitions: having left one's job and ceased to work, typically upon reaching pensionable age
examples: My retired parents now travel around the world
She's a retired teacher who volunteers at the library

definitions: made or produced by human beings rather than occurring naturally
not sincere or genuine; false or contrived in manner
examples: The lake is artificial, created by damming the river
Many foods contain artificial flavors and preservatives
Her artificial smile didn't hide her true feelings
He spoke with an artificial accent to impress others

definitions: originating or occurring naturally in a particular place; native to a specific region
examples: We must protect indigenous plant species from invasive ones
The museum displays art from indigenous peoples of Australia

definitions: kept out of sight; concealed from view or knowledge
examples: The treasure was hidden beneath the old oak tree
There are hidden costs not mentioned in the advertisement

definitions: containing or being poisonous material especially when capable of causing death or serious illness
very bad, unpleasant, or harmful in a pervasive or insidious way
examples: Keep toxic chemicals away from children and pets
The factory released toxic waste into the river
Their toxic relationship was damaging to both parties
The workplace had a toxic culture of harassment

definitions: lying or situated beneath something else; fundamental but not immediately obvious
examples: We need to address the underlying causes of poverty
The underlying message of the story is about forgiveness

definitions: of professional quality or status rather than amateur
in favor of or supporting something
examples: She plays tennis at a pro level now
He uses pro audio equipment for recording
The senator is pro environmental protection legislation
Most students are pro longer lunch breaks

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a colony or colonies, especially those of European powers
relating to the period of the thirteen British colonies in America before independence
examples: Many African nations gained independence from colonial rule
The museum features furniture from the colonial period
They live in a beautiful colonial style house
Colonial Williamsburg recreates life in the 1700s

definitions: relating to Iran, its people, or their language
examples: She's studying Iranian history and culture at university
The restaurant serves authentic Iranian cuisine

definitions: having exceptional talent or natural ability in a particular area
examples: The school has special programs for gifted students
She's a gifted musician who plays multiple instruments

definitions: done, situated, or used outside rather than in a building
examples: We enjoy outdoor activities like hiking and camping
The wedding reception was held at an outdoor venue

definitions: being on fire or producing flames and heat
very keen, intense, or passionate in feeling or expression
examples: The burning building was evacuated within minutes
We could smell burning rubber from the car
She had a burning desire to become a doctor
It's a burning issue that needs immediate attention

definitions: working by itself with little or no direct human control
done or occurring spontaneously without conscious thought or intention
examples: The building has automatic doors that open when approached
She drives a car with automatic transmission
Breathing is an automatic response of the body
His polite response was automatic after years of practice

definitions: operated by a machine or machinery; relating to physical forces or motion
done without thought or spontaneity; seeming like a machine in lacking emotion
examples: The car has a mechanical problem with the engine
He studied mechanical engineering to design machines
She gave a mechanical smile that lacked warmth
His mechanical movements showed he was just going through motions

definitions: showing signs of future success or excellence; having or showing potential
examples: The young scientist shows promising results in cancer research
It's a promising start to the new business venture

definitions: fastened securely in position; not able to be moved
predetermined and not able to be changed; set
examples: The mirror is fixed firmly to the bathroom wall
Make sure the shelf is properly fixed before use
We have fixed prices with no hidden charges
The meeting is at a fixed time every Monday

definitions: typical of a particular group, class, or body of opinion
acting or speaking officially for another person or group
examples: This painting is representative of her early work
The survey needs a representative sample of voters
She serves as the union representative for teachers
Each district elects a representative to Congress

definitions: made larger or longer in space or time
stretched out to full length or width
examples: We took an extended vacation to Europe this summer
The store offers extended warranties on electronics
He lay with extended arms on the beach
The cat was sleeping in an extended position

definitions: gentle and not easily provoked; moderate in type, degree, effect, or force
examples: She has a mild personality that everyone likes
We're having mild weather for this time of year

definitions: turned into ice or covered with ice as a result of extreme cold
unable to move or react, as from shock or fear
examples: The frozen pond is perfect for ice skating
Buy frozen vegetables when fresh ones aren't available
She stood frozen with fear when she saw the snake
He was frozen in place by the shocking news

definitions: regarded as likely to happen or be the case in the future
examples: The expected delivery date is next Tuesday afternoon
Higher than expected sales boosted company profits

definitions: extraordinarily good or excellent; wonderful
very great in amount, scale, or intensity
examples: She did a terrific job organizing the charity event
The movie got terrific reviews from all the critics
The storm caused terrific damage to coastal areas
He was driving at a terrific speed down the highway
